title: The Resistance Forces
opening: Three seperate islands: Fibernia, Caldonia, and Dia. All of these islands are rich in minerals, and mining is the economic backbone. The largest mine located in Eburacum, in north of Fibernia. Roy leads his forces toward Eburacum hoping to learn more about the bandits. To get to Eburacum, one must pass a castle located nearby. Roy sends a messenger to Sir Nord, lord of the castle, to resuqest permission to pass through his lands. Because Roy and company are in Isles on Etruria's request, they don't anticipate trouble in gaining Nord's support. But not everything is as simple as it appears...

intro.speaker: Nord
intro.line: What can you tell me about that spy from the resistance?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: You mean the dancer called Larum? We threw her in the dungeon, sire.

intro.speaker: Nord
intro.line: Has she told you anything?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: No. She keeps insisting that she's not affiliated with the resistance.

intro.speaker: Nord
intro.line: A liar, is she? Perhaps I could interrogate her myself...

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Sir Nord!

intro.speaker: Nord
intro.line: What is it?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: There is a messenger here from the Lycian Army.

intro.speaker: Nord
intro.line: Ah, the army that was sent to clean up tthe bandits on the Isles.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: It seems that they want permission to pass through to Eburacum.

intro.speaker: Nord
intro.line: ...Lord Arcard told us to get rid of the Lycian Army in their time here. Heh heh heh... If we impress Lord Arcard he may see fit to reward us. Desploy the troops and finish them here!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Yes, sire... And the messenger?

intro.speaker: Nord
intro.line: Kill him.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Understood, sire.

intro.speaker: Nord
intro.line: Be sure to deploy the ballista. Use it to defeat the Lycian Army before they even reach you.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Yes, sire.

intro.speaker: Nord
intro.line: Just make sure the enemy doesn't get hold of it!

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Lord Roy, soldiers are flowing out from the castle.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Are there bandits around here?

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: No, they seem to be heading towards us, actually.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: ...What about the messenger?

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: He hasn't returned... Which may mean the worst...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: He hasn't returned? Why is Sir Nord attack us?

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: The enemy draws near... Lord Roy, what are your orders?

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: ...I guess we have no choice but to fight. We might learn something if we can reach the castle.

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Yes, milord. You're right.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: All right, storm the castle! But have mercy! Some of their soldiers may be willing to listen!

battle.speaker: Woman
battle.line: Geese... You're really leaving?

battle.speaker: Geese
battle.line: The lord of that castle killed my mates. I won't let their deaths be unavenged.

battle.speaker: Woman
battle.line: You mean that crew that was always with you...

battle.speaker: Geese
battle.line: Yeah... They were taken to the mines and told that they would be given work. But they were all worked like slaves until they... died.

battle.speaker: Geese
battle.line: Maybe they weren't the brightest bunch, but they were good people... And they were killed... just like that...!!

battle.speaker: Woman
battle.line: Do you intend to avenge them on your own?

battle.speaker: Geese
battle.line: Is there something wrong with that?

battle.speaker: Woman
battle.line: No... But I thought you were going to go back to your merchant business.

battle.speaker: Geese
battle.line: Yeah, well, I've got bigger problems now... Once my mates get their revenge, and once the war subsides, maybe I will.

battle.speaker: Woman
battle.line: ...We won't forget you, Geese. You and your crew risked your lives to get us food and supplies. If you ever need anything, we'll be here.

battle.speaker: Geese
battle.line: Maybe I'll take you up on that, if I'm still alive. ...Thanks.

battle.speaker: Geese
battle.line: Yeah? What? You got something to say to me?

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: I want to ask you why you're fighting against the soldiers.

battle.speaker: Geese
battle.line: Who wants to know?

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: Roy, leader of the Lycian Army. We're here on behalf of Etruria...

battle.speaker: Geese
battle.line: You're with Etruria?! Then you're the enemy. Get ready to die!

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: Slow down! We're fighting the castle's troops too.

battle.speaker: Geese
battle.line: And yet Etruria sent you? I don't understand.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: I don't either. We were sent by Etruria to get rid of bandits here, but something's strange.

battle.speaker: Geese
battle.line: ...You say you're fighting the castle's troops. I'm for hire, if you'll take me.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: What?

battle.speaker: Geese
battle.line: I'm a seafaring man, so I know both the land and sea around the Isles. You look a bit lost, so I could be a good guide for you.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: That would help, but why?

battle.speaker: Geese
battle.line: I want to help with your mission. To be honest, I'm a pirate, so I'm probably the type you were sent to get rid of. But I only go after the rich. They have more than their fair share anyway.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: Well then, if you'll join us, we're pleased to have you. We don't know this area at all, so it's been difficult thus far.

battle.speaker: Geese
battle.line: Sounds like we have a deal! Leave it to me!

battle.speaker: Geese
battle.line: ...This is it, lads. Can you taste it? You'll have your vengeance. And after you do, I might just tag along with this Roy fellow for a while...

battle.speaker: Nord
battle.line: Gonzalez! Gonzalez, where are you?!

battle.speaker: Gonzalez
battle.line: Here... I here...

battle.speaker: Nord
battle.line: There's a village to the north, right along the mountain. Do you understand?

battle.speaker: Gonzalez
battle.line: Understand.

battle.speaker: Nord
battle.line: It may be a resistance base. I want you to go and burn it to the ground, village and all.

battle.speaker: Gonzalez
battle.line: Village and all...

battle.speaker: Nord
battle.line: Good. You understand. This is the only use I have for a lump such as you. Now get goung, you halfwit, before you forget your orders.

battle.speaker: Nord
battle.line: Forget how to speak? Are you trying to say something?

battle.speaker: Gonzalez
battle.line: N-no...

battle.speaker: Nord
battle.line: Such a monsterous face, and yet such a needlessly compassionate heart. He will learn the value of destroying a village firsthand!

recruit-talk.speaker: Gonzalez
recruit-talk.line: W-what you doing?! I am enemy!

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: I know... But there's such a look of sorrow in your eyes.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gonzalez
recruit-talk.line: ...There is a village near mountain. You know?

recruit-talk.speaker: Gonzalez
recruit-talk.line: Tell people escape. I have order. Destroy village. I...

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: What? Don't! The villagers are innocent...

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: It sounds to me like you should leave the person who gave you that order.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: Yes! You can fight with us. We're protecting the villagers.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gonzalez
recruit-talk.line: No... I monster... People mean to me... People throw stones... People say "Go away!"... "You a monster!"... Not human...

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: That's horrible! Of course you're human! You're a very kind-hearted man. I can tell. Please, come with us. Don't be afraid.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gonzalez
recruit-talk.line: Me afraid? I never afraid! Everyone afraid of ME! I not afraid!

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: No. You ARE afraid. You're afraid that people will throw stones and call you a monster.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: But you don't have to be afraid of us. Everyone in our army is nice. They won't do that to you. Be brave... Take that first step, and you'll never have to be afraid again.

boss.speaker: Nord
boss.line: You made it all the way here. But I shall take your pathetic lives...

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: I'm worried about Larum. I hope she's all right. She smuggled us weapons so we could defend ourselves. Even when we begged her to hide, she refused and kept helping us. Here's an axe that she brought us. It's a strange one... It's strong against swords, but weak against lances! I'd gladly trade it for her safety, though, so please, take it...

visit.speaker: Old Woman
visit.line: Brigands and pirates... They were all just as innocent as anyone when they were young. Maybe if you spoke to some of them, you could make them understand.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Lord Roy... We couldn't find any evidence explaining Sir Nord's aggression.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: But now we know for certain that somebody wants our heads.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: I think we should contact Etruria about this.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Yes, I'll send a message to General Cecilia.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Excuse me, Lord Roy. We found a girl imprisoned in the dungeon. She wishes to speak with you.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: To me? Let her pass.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Yes, milord.

end.speaker: Larum
end.line: You're Roy? The one who's here to clear out the bandits?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Yes, that's me.

end.speaker: Larum
end.line: I beg you, Roy! Please rescue my friends!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Whoa, easy there!

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Hey! Get off of him!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: C-calm down and tell me everything. You say your friends are in danger?

end.speaker: Larum
end.line: My name is Larum. I'm part of the resistance force on the Isles.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: The force that's fighting against the bandits?

end.speaker: Larum
end.line: Yes. ...Actually, no!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: No?

end.speaker: Larum
end.line: That's part of it, but the real enemy is Etruria! They work with the bandits to squeeze every bit they can out of the people here!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What?! Is that true?!

end.speaker: Larum
end.line: The lords living here take people into the mines and work them to death!! They're allowed no rest, even if they're sick or injured.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...That's terrible...

end.speaker: Larum
end.line: We're fighting Etruria to stop the abuse! Our next plan was to attack the mine at Eburacum and rescue the people there! But...but...!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Calm down! You can tell me.

end.speaker: Larum
end.line: A villager here leaked the details of the plan! He was probably tortured... I have to go to the mines before the resistance is ambushed!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Then there's no time to spare! We'll backup the resistance force and rescue the people being forced into labor!

end.speaker: Larum
end.line: Truly, you will?! Thank you, Roy!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Whoa! L-Larum!

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Hey! I said get off of him!

end.speaker: Larum
end.line: Here, Roy. Use this sword.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What is it?

end.speaker: Larum
end.line: It's called a wyrmslayer. It's effective against wyvern riders, and it's said it was used against dragons, too. Who can say, though? It might come in handy. It belongs to Echidna, the leader of the resistance. You're helping us though, so you can have it for now.
